channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-2366] Tests DerbyNetNewServer and SecureServerTest fails on weme 6.1
item.description:
The DerbyNetNewServer and SecureServerTest fails on weme 6.1.

There were 5 errors:
1) DerbyNetNewServer(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.NetHarnessJavaTest)java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

item.summary: Tests DerbyNetNewServer and SecureServerTest fails on weme 6.1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
With 10.3.0.0 alpha - (510766), I observed the SecureServerTest test still fails on weme 6.1.

SecureServerTest( Opened = false, Authenticated= false )java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax.naming.Referenceable

Will wait for another run before reopening this issue.
Test still fails as described by Rajesh as of 10.3.0.0 alpha - (511195)

I see the failure when running with jars. One of the problems is that SecureServerTest uses non-public apis and thus the class fails to load if derbynet.jar is not in the classpath. Tests should not be using internal engine or network server code.

Agreed, but unfortunately, derbynet.jar (and derbyclient.jar) is referenced in derbyrun.jar.
And I think it is appropriate to have derbyrun.jar in the classpath.
Or am I wrong in that?
Fixed by fixing DERBY-2378
